intro: Cystopus elwesii, commonly known as the African stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are thick and often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Cystopus elwesii produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the warmer months.
